0e0d0c7b-a5df-48d1-b63f-b614005e8a81: A daredevil gains a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility checks{/g} equal to half its {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}.
f6157a1e-cacf-42b0-8532-a1bb47761cae: A wrecker's {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} ignore an inanimate object's {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. At 9th level, a wrecker's natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} count as if they were adamantine for the purpose of overcoming a construct's {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction.
6d2e7cea-03ac-4a08-a3cf-8262cc7d03b7: All {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made by an animal companion are treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. An animal companion gains a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack rolls and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and +1 resistance bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. These bonuses increase by 1 for every 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} the animal companion has.
5d426313-2717-4d14-91dd-39a83651d2d4: An aggressor's first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} in every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, if it hits, makes the enemy bleed for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each round. The aggressor also gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack and damage rolls against the target. This bonus increases at 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter.
7c74a14a-2ede-4836-a37e-ffb735edf0b7: An animal companion gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects.
25f70658-3c07-4ab0-877f-13e8a608b4e0: Animal companions receive {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to their natural armor.
02d5f566-4b43-477b-81c3-a1180baf6e58: Animal companions receive {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}.
d7245acc-02e0-44a0-9582-f9ba5652fda5: At 6th level, a deathtouched companion gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against effects that could not normally affect objects or undead.
b1fb3ce3-40f8-483f-b67a-680161177827: At 9th level, a daredevil can't be {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g}.
8a88e9b5-ca10-4166-a6e6-bc3705d5527b: At 9th level, whenever a bully succeeds at a bull rush, overrun, or trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}, after fully resolving the combat maneuver, it gains a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} until the end of its next turn.
e2427457-56b5-4b3c-a8b4-77917754297c: Bigger than others of its kind, a bully is used to winning fights and displays of dominance for its choice of mates, territory, or other privileges.
73defb9d-4691-42f8-b4ac-a16c753d7318:
Bite; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 12)
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}
{g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Cure{/g}: 2 consecutive saves
The save DC is {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}-based.
16d1597b-f4f5-4cd8-b467-101b81a232d6: Companions with the most vicious nature are often called aggressors.
6da059c7-de89-43f0-8222-f97ba8051454: Companions with the sturdiest skin, who can endure incredible amounts of suffering, are called bulwarks.
7a098782-8355-4af6-b8fa-88ce829051f2: Daredevil companions join the fray with graceful leaps or swooping dives, heedless of the danger.
8535f5d3-2a54-475c-b69b-a8110bc10a3f: From level 1 on, while a racer is wearing no armor and carrying a light load, its {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. From level 6 on, it's increased by 20 feet instead.
6e856910-5c8b-4df0-803b-dd0cbd1532b8: If an animal companion is subjected to an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that normally allows a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, it takes no damage if it makes a successful saving throw.
1c70323a-90ef-4061-b5c3-6639e1f65339: Like unruly pets, some companions have a tendency to destroy nearby objects while unsupervised, and their masters can channel these destructive impulses into an advantage in battle.
8f07f07a-12e5-43b0-8353-8f6d028f6149: Some companions have uncanny {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, providing their masters with swift transport.
5cb177a1-f286-43da-9306-70743a26b4b3: Some companions live lives of faithful devotion and steady vigilance, standing watch through long hours and always ready to leap into action to protect their masters.
55eac0c1-1c73-43d6-8beb-2eea38ce6c18: The bulwark gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 2/-. At 4th level and every 4 levels thereafter, it increases by 1.
b5542133-c5cf-4114-94d4-4f2d20ce5021: Though a living creature, a deathtouched companion reacts to positive and negative energy as if it were undead: positive energy harms it, while negative energy {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} it.
c291545a-14ca-499e-90ea-34054ab5eaa7: When subjected to an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that normally allows a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, an animal companion takes no damage if it makes a successful saving throw and only half damage if the saving throw fails.
c9b71475-2a5d-4ba8-a7bb-760d4493a621: Whether the result of a partially successful attempt at revival, a strange blight, or repeated exposure to undead, deathtouched companions are living animals with a trace of the undead, somewhat like dhampirs.
f12305f9-0fe1-49a2-af40-96b0d2495fd0: You can continue advancing your current existing companion.
6a4f7204-e60d-488a-bd01-aa81e3002d78: You get a powerful undead minion — a skeletal champion that specializes in archery. It will become more powerful as you gain new mythic ranks. Just like your companions, this skeletal champion can use any items and also has all the {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}weapon proficiencies{/g}. Being undead, it is also subject to all the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} undead get being under the command of the Mythic Lich.
8387552d-0540-4193-8c45-c461d8b2e567: You get a powerful undead minion — a skeletal champion that specializes in defense. It will become more powerful as you gain new mythic ranks. Just like your companions, this skeletal champion can use any items and also has all the {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}weapon proficiencies{/g}. Being undead, it is also subject to all the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} undead get being under the command of the Mythic Lich.
075194d1-bf10-4e6b-a74c-a4fb5c1aee97: You get a powerful undead minion — a skeletal champion that specializes in devastating {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapons. It will become more powerful as you gain new mythic ranks. Just like your companions, this skeletal champion can use any items and also has all the {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}weapon proficiencies{/g}. Being undead, it is also subject to all the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} undead get being under the command of the Mythic Lich.
962c9d46-8388-47c7-b79d-3d12f1344fe4: You get a powerful undead minion — a skeletal champion that specializes in fast {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with two weapons. It will become more powerful as you gain new mythic ranks. Just like your companions, this skeletal champion can use any items and also has all the {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}weapon proficiencies{/g}. Being undead, it is also subject to all the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} undead get being under the command of the Mythic Lich.
f2f4e239-e417-49eb-b1f3-eb80486e8650: You get a powerful undead minion — a skeletal champion. It will become more powerful as you gain new mythic ranks. Just like your companions, this skeletal champion can use any items and also has all the {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}weapon proficiencies{/g}. Being undead, it is also subject to all the bonuses undead get being under the command of the Mythic Lich.
c8df6432-d326-4ee5-9154-2982d1809b56:
{g|Encyclopedia:Size}Size{/g}: Large
{g|Encyclopedia:Speed}Speed{/g}: 50 ft.
{g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}: +4 natural armor
{g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attack{/g}: bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}), 2 hooves (1d6)
{g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}Ability scores{/g}: {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Str{/g} 16, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dex{/g} 13, {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} 15, {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Int{/g} 2, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wis{/g} 12, {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Cha{/g} 6
Special qualities: low-light vision, {g|Encyclopedia:Scent}scent{/g}.
At 4th level gains Str +2, Con +2, and hoof attacks become primary.
When riding a horse, you gain +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and on attack rolls against enemies of medium size or smaller.
8d368f6c-d645-4670-b5b8-c5e52ef2878c:

{g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}: +4 natural armor

{g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}Ability scores{/g}: {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Str{/g} 13, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dex{/g} 17, {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} 13, {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Int{/g} 2, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wis{/g} 15, {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Cha{/g} 10
At 7th level size becomes Large, Str +8, Dex -2, Con +4, +2 natural armor, gains pounce.

{g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}: can't be tripped.
At 7th level size becomes Large, Str +8, Dex -2, Con +4, +2 natural armor.
This animal companion can't be used as a mount.
